ygData.subject: Re: Twinking
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, I m breaking my own heart here, but my friend who is cancelling her account gave me all of her stuff . . . almost full lambent, singing steel boots,
ygData.messageBody:
Well, I'm breaking my own heart here, but my
friend who is cancelling her account gave me all of her
stuff . . . almost full lambent, singing steel boots,
eight different weapons and instruments(including a
yak, blade of firey lamentations, mistmoore drums,
lute of the gypsy princess, etc . . .), and her 300pp
left over. All I could say at the time was "Damn!" I
seriously have never had so much stuff before . . . and
now, I have to learn how to play a bard. (Never played
one past lvl 7.) I really can't solo that well,
unless I find her 51 shammie friend who buffs me up when
he's on. Then . . . well, then I'm killing red mobs
for as long as talisman lasts. :) And I have never
had so many people ask to inspect me! Wow . . .
although I imagine a 5 bard running around in lambent with
MM drums kinda invites that. I will say that I love
having all the stuff, and I hope she doesn't unfreeze
her account any time soon.<br><br>As for knowledge
being twinking, I never thought about that, but it's
definately true. I can start almost anywhere (especially
Qeynos or Kelethin/Felwithe) and know the best possible
way to level. But I always help my newer friends out
with info.<br><br>~Kanissa, 35 druid, Rodcet
Nife<br>~Catallus, the super-twinked bard of Prexus
